q:
In Databricks, you are working on the authentication using Databricks personal access tokens in SQL Analytics. If you are required to use a personal access token to access the Databricks REST API, which of the following bash commands is used pass the token to the Bearer Authentication:
Bash commands
1.

curl -u : -X GET 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/

2.

curl -n -X GET 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/get?id

3.

curl -X GET -H 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/
In Databricks, determine the default visualisation types in the Databricks SQL Analytics.

In Databricks, you are defining the data access privileges while configuring the table access control in Databricks SQL Analytics. You want the users to have the functionality to create their own tables in a sandbox area which gives access to only the specific user or his team. For this, you have set up private user storage. If your database name is MyHackDB and the user name that has access to write data to is Ben with the domain name hackerearth.com, then which of the following SQL queries must be implemented to perform this action in this scenario:
SQL queries:
1.

CREATE READ_METADATA ON MyHackDB LOCATION "s3a://HackerEarth/MyBucket/home/Databricks/Private/Users/Ben"; GRANT USAGE CREATE, USAGE ON DATABASE MyHackDB TO `ben@hackerearth.com`;

2.

CREATE READ_METADATA ON MyHackDB LOCATION "s3a://HackerEarth/MyBucket/home/Databricks/Private/Users/Ben";

3.

CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS MyHackDB LOCATION "s3a://HackerEarth/MyBucket/home/Databricks/Private/Users/Ben"; GRANT CREATE, USAGE ON DATABASE MyHackDB TO `ben@hackerearth.com`;

4.

CREATE READ_METADATA ON MyHackDB LOCATION "s3a://HackerEarth/MyBucket/home/Databricks/Private/Users/Ben" AT ‘ben@hackerearth,com’;

In Databricks, you are working various Data object privileges from the Databricks SQL Analytics. You are required to assign permission to the object for a group of users named teachers to perform various operations for this object at the database level. The access must allow to view all the tables stored in the school database along with its metadata. Now, which of the following SQL queries must be performed in this scenario:
SQL queries
1.

GRANT USAGE, SELECT, WRITE_METADATA ON DATABASE school TO teachers;

2.

GRANT USAGE, SELECT, READ_METADATA ON DATABASE school TO `teachers`;

3.

GRANT USAGE, SELECT, WRITE_METADATA ON school for teachers

4.

GRANT USAGE, SELECT, ON DATABASE school for teachers

In Databricks, you are working on the Alert access control in the Databricks SQL Analytics. You have invoked your methods on the following REST endpoint to manage the alert permissions by using an API. Now, if you are required to set the Can Manage permission to the user bob.smith@hackerearth.com, then which of the following Bash commands must be implemented to perform this action in this scenario:

REST endpoint:

/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/


Bash commands:
1.

git -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/ -X PATCH -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

2.

curl -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/access_controls/sql/alert/code -M user -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

3.

git -m 'REST:' https:///api/2.0/access_controls/sql/alert/code -M user -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com"}]}'

4.

curl -u 'token:' https:///api/2.0/permissions/sql/alert/ -X PATCH -d '{ "access_control_list" : [ { "user_name": bob.smith@hackerearth.com", "permission_level": "CAN_MANAGE" } ] }'

In Databricks, you are working on the alert tasks from the Databricks SQL Analytics. You are creating your alert. After searching for a target query that is published, you are configuring the Trigger when field. Now, which of the following properties can be checked in order to configure this field in this scenario:

Properties

  1. Value column
  2. Condition
  3. Template
  4. Threshold

In Databricks, you are working on the data access configuration in the Databricks SQL Analytics. If you are required to configure the table access control, then which of the following sequences of steps must be implemented in this scenario:
Steps:

  1. Configure access to cloud storage.
  2. Set up group synchronization to create groups.
  3. Set object ownership.
  4. Register tables and define data access privileges.
  5. Define data access privileges.

In Databricks, you are working on Databricks SQL Analytics. If you are required to add a new user and grant him the Can use permission after creating an SQL endpoint for him, then which of the following should be used to perform this action in this scenario?

In Databricks, you are working on the Databricks SQL Analytics. If you are required to schedule your query, then which of the following statements are correct:
Statements

  1. If you schedule an interval for every 15 minutes, then the interval is calculated from the first successful execution.
  2. If you manually execute a query, the scheduled query will not be executed until the interval has passed.
  3. If you have a query set to refresh every Thursday and you manually execute it on Wednesday, by Thursday the results will still be considered “valid”.

In Databricks, you are managing users and groups in the Databricks SQL Analytics. If you are required to grant group access to SQL Analytics, then which of the following sequences of steps must be followed in this scenario:
Steps:

  1. Click the Entitlements tab.
  2. Go to the Groups tab.
  3. Select the SQL Analytics access checkbox.
  4. Click the group name.
  5. Go to the admin console.

Alice is working on Databricks SQL Analytics. She is required to connect the Databricks SQL Analytics SQL endpoints to the BI tools. So, she has decided to connect the Databricks Cluster to Power BI by using the built-in Databricks connector. She has tried to implement the following six steps to perform this action in this scenario. Now, Which of the following statements is used to replace X in step 2 in this scenario to complete the process:

Steps:
Step 1: Get Databricks connection information like hostname, port, and HTTP path.
Step 2: X
Step 3: Enter the Server Hostname and HTTP Path after clicking on Connect.
Step 4: Select the data connectivity mode.
Step 5: Select a way to authenticate to Databricks at the Authentication prompt either through entering the username and password or through the Personal Access Token
Step 6: Finally click on connect and select the Databricks data to query from the Power BI Navigator.

a.option: Navigate to Settings > Power BI > AWS Connector
Navigate to Settings > Integration> Power BI > Power BI Desktop > Azure Connector
Navigate to Get Data > Azure and click on Azure Databricks connector
Navigate to Settings > Power BI > Azure Connector

q:
In Databricks, you are working on the Databricks SQL Analytics. Which of the following statements about the security statements are correct:
Statements

  1. The statement DENY denies a privilege on an object to a user or principal.
  2. The statement RMV removes all the privileges associated with a table.
  3. The statement REVOKE revokes an explicitly granted or denied privilege on an object from a user or principal.

In Databricks, you are working on the Dashboard Access Control from the Databricks SQL Analytics. If the users have the following abilities, then which of the permissions can be granted to the user in this scenario:
Abilities

  1. Edit the dashboard
  2. Modify the dashboard
  3. Delete the dashboard

a.option: Both can run and can manage

q:
In Databricks, you are working on SQL Analytics. If you are required to implement the alerts on multiple columns such as emp_added_count and emp_removed_count from a table named data, then which of the following SQL queries can be used to perform this action in this scenario:
Queries
1.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(CASE WHEN is_removed THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_removed_count
FROM employee_table) data

2.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count
FROM employee_table) data

3.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(CASE WHEN is_added THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count

4.

SELECT CASE WHEN emp_added_count > 100 AND emp_removed_count > 15 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END
FROM (
SELECT sum(is_added) AS emp_added_count,
sum(is_remove) AS emp_removed_count
from employee

In Databricks, you are working on the Databricks SQL Analytics. If you are required to implement the Funnel visualization technique for your query, then which of the following fields are mandatory in this scenario?
In Databricks, you are working on the Databricks SQL Analytics. Which of the following visualization aggregates records from a query result into a new tabular display?

In Databricks, you are working on Databricks SQL Analytics. Which of the following is used to filter the list of queries and dashboards that are visible when you checkout the SQL Analytics landing page and SQL Analytics dashboards lists?
